In talking with Coda last night I decided to start writing a Ruby version of metrics -- slowly adding measurements but available on GH: https://github.com/johnewart/ruby-metrics
@steveklabnik +1 for posting on changelog
I just forked.

There's also a Python port of Ostrich (https://github.com/wadey/python-ostrich) which has some similar functionality.
Let's see if we can get you some contributors: http://thechangelog.com/post/4504318741/ruby-metrics-it-pretty-much-explains-itself

I did some work on it last night. I'm working on multiple backends and more metrics to track. Still need tests, but its a start. I'll push my changes once I get them stable
I wrote a gem called aggregate a while back if you want some basic histogram support: https://github.com/josephruscio/aggregate
No reservoir sampling, but I was thinking of adding something like that after @coda's talk
